description: Suriname closed all schools effective March 16th. The plan is to reopen schools the 15th of April. UPDATE: Originally, the Minister of Education announced that schools will reopen on the 15th of April. However, on April 2nd, she announced that they cannot enforce existing policies in schools. As a result, schools remain closed until the policies can be enforced.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of the 11th of May Suriname has instated a nationwide curfew from 23:00 - 05:00. The policy is set to end on the 18th of May. Update: As of the 21st of May 2021, the government is enforcing a curfew lasting until the 3rd of June. Residents to stay in their homes from 18:00 to 05:00. UPDATE: There is a new curfew implemented by the Government applying over the weekends of the 22nd, 23rd, 29th and 30th of May, 2021.

Only essential services and those having permit from Ministry of Justice and Peace may be outside their residence during curfew.
